alert.note: Alert for Pecos (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 25 at 6:36AM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Pecos County through 715 AM CDT... At 635 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 15 miles northwest of Sanderson, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Pecos County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
